description.narrative: Assisting the Government of the Republic of Belarus in Accession to the World Trade Organization through Strengthening National Institutional Capacity and Expertise (Phase 5)

participating-org.narrative: Min of Foreign Affairs of RB

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. Carrying out the required analytical work on assessment of potential impacts of WTO accession on Belarus’ economy (by individual sectors) and to develop potential scenarios for minimization and prevention of negative impacts of WTO accession and to identify options. 2. Translation of the normative legal acts and other documents from/into English/Russian; simultaneous translation at bilateral and multilateral negotiations; and to organize access to economic and legal databases. 3. Establishment of National Center on WTO (the output will be financed by the Government of the Republic of Belarus). 4. Participation of representatives of the government bodies, academia, education and business community in WTO events. 5. Improving competence up to 100 members of the Inter-Agency Commission on Belarus’ Accession to WTO directly involved in the negotiation process. 6. At least 30 independent experts, teaching staff and specialists offering WTO related counselling and training will improve qualifications. 7. High level of awareness about the most relevant aspects of the process, status and impacts of WTO accession, and the rules of operation within WTO for the regional business community; at least 1,000 people participated in the project activities.

comment.narrative: 1. Lack of analytical studies for the governmental officials on the issues related to the WTO accession process in general and probable implications for individual sectors. 2. Shortage of national expertise at national organizations, institutions and government agencies on various aspects of WTO accession. 3. Insufficient public awareness regarding WTO rules and country's accession process among target audiences of business community.

1. To finalize concept and founding documents of the National Center on WTO. 2. To prepare at least 2 analytical materials to support the negotiation process. 3. To improve of competence up to 30 members of the Inter-Agency Commission on Belarus’ Accession to WTO directly involved in the negotiation process. 4. To improve of qualification at least 10 independent experts, teaching staff and specialists offering WTO related counselling and training. 5. To organize at least 6 awareness-raising activities about benefits and impact of WTO accession are conducted for the regional business community.

1. 1 analytical work was carried out on assessment of potential impacts of WTO accession on Belarus’ economy (by individual sectors) and to develop potential scenarios for minimization and prevention of negative impacts of WTO accession and to identify options. 2. 50 documents (legal acts of the Republic of Belarus and others) were translated from/into English. The documents will be used for the negotiation process. 3. Finalized concept and founding documents of the national WTO Center. 4. 44 representatives of the government bodies, academia, education and business community participated in WTO events. 5. Improved competence of 251 members of the Inter-Agency Commission on Belarus’ Accession to WTO directly involved in the negotiation process. 6. 10 independent experts, teaching staff and specialists offering WTO related counselling and training improved qualifications. 7. High level of awareness about the most relevant aspects of the process, status and impacts of WTO accession, and the rules of operation within WTO for the regional business community: 369 people participated in the project activities.

1. To support the MFA Belarus in creating the National Center on WTO. 2. To prepare at least 2 analytical materials to support the negotiation process. 3. To improve of competence up to 20 members of the Inter-Agency Commission on Belarus’ Accession to WTO directly involved in the negotiation process. 4. To improve of qualification at least 10 independent experts, teaching staff and specialists offering WTO related counselling and training. 5. To organize at least 6 awareness-raising activities about benefits and impact of WTO accession are conducted for the regional business community. 6. To facilitate of national experts in participating in WTO events.

1. The MFA Belarus, together with interested government bodies, developed the concept of the National Center on WTO. There is currently a discussion of the concept with those interested. 2. Two analytical materials were prepared: a report that reflects the current position of Belarus in international trade and among partners in the EAEU, as well as a report on relevant international experience and best practices to increase the production and export potential of Belarusian enterprises and joint ventures. 3. Improved competence of 74 members of the Inter-Agency Commission on Belarus’ Accession to WTO directly involved in the negotiation process. 4. Due to restrictions related to COVID-19, training has been postponed to 2021. 5. Organized a series of 4 scientific and practical seminars “The Republic of Belarus on the eve of accession to the World Trade Organization: new conditions and realities”. About 200 representatives of the business community and academia from all regions of Belarus increased their awareness on the WTO issues. Due to restrictions related to COVID-19, information campaigns have been limited. Some of the events have been postponed to 2021. 6. Provided support to national experts for participation in three WTO events. Also organized 5 virtual WTO workshops on the WTO SPS and TF Agreements for 100 representatives of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Belarus, Ministry of Agriculture and Food of the Republic of Belarus, as well as independent experts, teaching staff and specialists offering WTO related counseling and training. 7. Organized the translation of 28 legal acts of the Republic of Belarus to be used for the negotiation process of the Republic of Belarus to the WTO. 8. Organized and prepared for publication “The Glossary of WTO Terms” in 2 national languages. The glossary contains more than 300 terms currently used in the World Trade Organization and commonly used in the area of trade policy and international trade. The glossary is designed for professionals, experts and diplomats working in the area of international trade, public administration, academia and business, students and teachers as well as anyone interested in international trade and trade policy.

1. To support the MFA Belarus in creating the National Center on WTO. 2. To prepare analytical materials to support the negotiation process. 3. To improve of competence up to 10 members of the Inter-Agency Commission on Belarus’ Accession to WTO directly involved in the negotiation process. 4. To improve of qualification at least 10 independent experts, teaching staff and specialists offering WTO related counselling and training. 5. To organize at least 6 awareness-raising activities about benefits and impact of WTO accession are conducted for the regional business community. 6. To facilitate of national experts in participating in WTO events. 7. To organize the Final project conference.

1. The National Center on the World Trade Organization was officially opened on the 9th of December 2021, at the National Center for Marketing and Price Study of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Belarus. At the initial stage, the Centers work is focused on advising Belarusian business entities on a different range of issues related to the countrys accession to the WTO. In the future, the list of services of the Center will be expanded. 2. Three analytical materials featuring potential WTO accession impact on national economy scenarios and offering options to mitigate negative externalities of the process have been developed. The analyses informed the Government negotiation team position and further direction of negotiations. 3. Improved competence of 54 members of the Inter-Agency Commission on Belarus’ Accession to WTO directly involved in the negotiation process, in matters of the WTO Agreement on Trade-Related Investment Measures and new methods and tools for negotiating WTO issues. 4. Improved qualification of 10 independent experts, teaching staff and specialists offering WTO related counselling and training at the Federal State Budgeted Educational Institution of Higher Education “Russian Foreign Trade Academy of the Ministry for the Economic Development of the Russian Federation”. Thanks to this, Belarusian experts launched special WTO courses in five Belarusian universities, thus multiplying the capacities and engaging young talents who will work in WTO environment. 5. Six regional roundtables with the business community on the accession of the Republic of Belarus to the World Trade Organization were arranged for 716 representatives of regional authorities, companies, business associations, higher educational institutions. Thanks to regional roundtables the Belarusian business community and local authorities raised their awareness about the most relevant aspects of the process, status and impact of WTO accession, as well as the basic rules of functioning within the WTO. 6. Provided support to 12 national experts for participation in three WTO events. This allowed the national side to significantly advance the agenda of the remaining negotiations with the WTO member countries and agree on the necessary conditions for the Republic of Belarus to join the WTO with the EAEU member states. 7. The Final project conference was postponed to 2022 due to the extension of the project implementation period. 8. Two documents (legal acts of the Republic of Belarus and others) were translated into English. The documents were used in the negotiation process. The Draft Report of the Working Group (364 pages) was translated into Russian. This allowed the national side to better understand the obligations that Belarus takes upon itself when joining the WTO. 9. The hands-on seminar “The Main Trends in International Trade in the Context of Belarus’ Accession to the World Trade Organization” were arranged for 54 officials of the republican government bodies, representing 30 ministries and agencies. As a result of the hands-on seminar, the participants raised their awareness of the current stage of Belarus accession to the WTO and increased their competence on issues related to the basic principles of regulation of the service sector and mechanisms for promoting the export of services of the Republic of Belarus in the context of the development of economic integration (EAEU, WTO and free trade zones); with foreign trade in agri-food products of the Republic of Belarus in the context of modern world trends; as well as with modern challenges and opportunities for foreign economic activity of Belarus.

1. To support the Ministry of Economy and the MFA in activities related to increasing transparency in the regulation of the service sector in the Republic of Belarus before joining the WTO. 2. To improve of competence up to 10 members of the Inter-Agency Commission on Belarus’ Accession to WTO directly involved in the negotiation process. 3. To facilitate of national experts in participating in WTO events. 4. To organize specialized seminars for regional government bodies and other stakeholders. 5. To organize the Final project conference.
